OrgName: VMware, Inc and its U.S. subsidiaries
activities:
Personal Information Received from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland: 

VMware, Inc. processes or contemplates processing EEA and Swiss personal data relating to: (1) its current, former, and prospective employees and those of any of its European subsidiaries/affiliates for purposes of global human resources administration and management; (2) representatives and employees of actual and prospective corporate customers and business partners in order to manage business relationships and provide information, and contracted products  and  services; (3) representatives and employees of actual and prospective vendors and suppliers in order to manage business relationships and receive contracted goods and services; (4) individuals whose data VMware, Inc. processes on behalf of business customers as a service provider or mere data processor; (5) product end users and prospective end users in order to provide information on services and products; (6) personal data that a customer, partner or their end users may place in their cloud when VMware is the cloud hosting provider; (7) information about VMware's business partners’, customers’ or their end users’ configuration and usage of VMware's products, services, software, applications and/or information about their IT environments, including details about the infrastructure, hardware, networks, computers, servers, systems, devices, and peripherals; (8) its officers, directors, employees, consultants, contractors, staffing agency workers, agents and other third parties and those of any of its European subsidiaries/affiliates for purposes of operating its hotline scheme, investigations, and enforcement of its Business Conduct Guidelines applicable to EEA/Switzerland; (9) individuals who inquire about or enroll in a VMware educational course or training program; (10) individuals who visit a VMware website or a website run by its business partners or service providers, including information collected from cookies, pixel tags, web beacons and other methods; (11)  individuals who use websites and/or mobile applications developed, sold or provided by VMware; (12) individuals who may inquire about or attend an event organized or sponsored by VMware or one of its business partners. 

VMware maintains a privacy policy for information it collects in connection with its online business activities. VMware does provide individuals with a reasonable mechanism to exercise their choices. In other areas, such as the provision of cloud hosting services, VMware acts as a data processor and holds and processes data at the direction of its customer (which acts as a data controller and is responsible for providing any notices and obtaining any required consents from the data subjects).
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Offline, online, manually processed informatin from, about or relating to our customers, customers' end users, prospective customers, suppliers, vendors, partners and human resources data
privacyprograms: VMware, Inc. will cooperate with the EEA and Swiss data protection authorities as its enforcement mechanism.
recoursemech: EU data protection authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).
